Label longitude and latitude

Source: R/scale_longitude.R

Provide easy functions for adding suffixes to longitude and latitude for labeling maps.

LonLabel(lon, east = "°E", west = "°O")

LatLabel(lat, north = "°N", south = "°S")

Arguments

lon

longitude in degrees
east, west, north, south

text to append for each cuadrant
lat

latitude in degrees

Details

The default values are for Spanish.

See also

Other ggplot2 helpers: DivideTimeseries, MakeBreaks, RepeatCircular, geom_arrow, geom_contour2, geom_contour_fill, geom_label_contour, geom_relief, geom_vector, guide_colourstrip, reverselog_trans, scale_divergent, scale_longitude, stat_na, stat_subset

Examples


LonLabel(0:360)

# If you want it to speak in English.
LonLabel <- function(...) metR::LonLabel(..., west = "\u00B0W")
